title: Microsoft lays off 8% of gaming staff
text: SAN FRANCISCO, California: Microsoft is laying off 1,900 people, or 8 percent of staff, from its gaming division as it consolidates the blockbuster buyout of "Call of Duty" maker Activision Blizzard. The head of Microsoft's gaming division, Phil Spencer, said in a memo to employees that the cuts came after synergies were found between the two companies, the company confirmed. Ad-free access
